page.title: 06Tendring Children cont.
page.content: Half the children brought packed lunches, a few went home, the rest ate school lunches. They liked fish fingers and ham salad, but disliked swede, mashed potatoes and mushy peas! Pocket money ranged from 25p to Â£1 per week, and most had to do jobs at home. Some read their parents' newspapers, from The Times to The Star, and had wide interests in books. Two pupils only did not have television - one did not like it. The majority went to Church and four sang in a Church choir. Some go abroad for the holidays but most holiday in Britain. Their ambitions when they grew up were very varied. Several wanted to join the Police, some go into professional sports, one into acting, a Chef, a Magician & an artist. One girl wanted to join the Navy and she also wanted to sail round the world.
